meanings.definition: To make something or someone more aligned with the principles or practices of the Republican Party.
meanings.sent1: She tried to republicanize her wardrobe by adding more red and blue outfits.
meanings.sent2: The group aimed to republicanize their campaign strategy to appeal to a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would republicanize his morning routine by only drinking coffee from red cups.
meanings.sent4: The new manager sought to republicanize the company's policies, bringing in more conservative practices.
meanings.sent5: The teacher wanted to republicanize the classroom decor with patriotic posters and flags.

meanings.definition: To convert to or adopt Republican beliefs or ideologies.
meanings.sent1: After attending the rally, she decided to republicanize her political views.
meanings.sent2: The candidate hoped to republicanize more voters before the election.
meanings.sent3: He playfully suggested they should republicanize their weekly book club meetings.
meanings.sent4: The documentary aimed to republicanize viewers by presenting conservative arguments in a compelling way.
meanings.sent5: The young student was eager to republicanize his understanding of government and policies.
